newsitem.title: UK: UK SIB bids to break pensions misselling logjam.
newsitem.headline: UK SIB bids to break pensions misselling logjam.

text.p: Britain's top financial markets watchdog on Wednesday announced a new strategy to try and clear a logjam in the pensions industry's review of the misselling of pension products and the payment of compensation to investors.

The proposals coincided with the publication of evidence that the two year investigation was substantially incomplete, for which regulators, insurance and investment companies have received a barrage of criticism.
"Those who persist in dragging their feet, should expect this to be taken as a prompt for regulatory action leading to appropriate discipline," he warned the companies involved.

The Personal Investment Authority (PIA), one of three regulators reporting to the SIB, on Wednesday published statistics on the progress of the review. They showed less than five percent of 520,000 cases have been fully investigated.

The Association of British Insurers (ABI), which said the review was at present costly and information difficult to obtain from the occupational schemes, welcomed the new proposals. The British Bankers Association (BBA) also supported the changes.
